duties_responsibilities.duty: Provide testing per specific test procedures using measuring instruments and computer test programs for vehicle systems or products.
Support customer support and training for new and existing customers in-house and in the field.
Support production and manufacturing functions as well as the production and assembly of test boards.
Maintain vehicle repairs, upgrades, and execution of test procedures in new and existing vehicles.
Perform pre-mission tasks such as vehicle mission programming, vehicle checkout, and recognize when something is out of specification.
Perform post-mission data download and analysis, and level one troubleshooting including visual inspection, use of DVM, and basic schematic reading.
Lead normal vehicle systems field operations for testing and design missions to perform needed tasks.
Document test results with appropriate information in a complete manner and communicate to all required.
Perform all job responsibilities in support of Product Quality Standards and communicate all design problems and bugs to the correct areas within the organization.
Local sea/boat testing at 25-40%, customer-site training as required at 1-2 weeks per trip, and possibility of some extensive travel; must be able to work in the field unsupervised.

Install, operate, maintain, repair, and modify equipment; perform a variety of maintenance and technical support on products such as equipment, integrated systems and subsystems, and software at customer and/or field locations.

Analyze and evaluate products and related performance; troubleshoot and diagnose malfunctions to eliminate problems in minimum time; install, upgrade, and remove products ensuring coordinative engineering field change; maintain effective customer communications, relations, and provide onsite training.

education_certification.credential: Associates Degree or other 2-year technical degree in a related discipline and 1 year of related experience, or High School Diploma or equivalent and 3 years related experience. Must have the ability to obtain and maintain a government clearance.
